definition: gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi
words of politeness/politesse/decorous talking/talk with propriety
you're welcome/don't mention it/no need to stand on ceremony
lit. no excessive politeness/Don't mention it!/You're welcome!/Please don't stand on ceremony.

sentences.english: Our guests, no matter where you come from, please make yourself at home.
sentences.chinese: 不管远近都是客人，请不用客气。
我这室友还真是客气啊。

sentences.english: You should deal with her more politely.
They are grossing me out too, you know.
sentences.chinese: 你知道，他们对我也并不客气。
“你自己动手，”亚瑟不客气地说。

sentences.english: Such unkind remark was not called for.
sentences.chinese: 这种不客气的话真不该讲。

sentences.english: You are welcome! Is there any position which could develop my best ability?
sentences.chinese: 不客气，您那边有可以让我发挥所长的岗位吗？

sentences.english: The Knight of the Couchant Leopard yielded a ready and courteous assent;
sentences.chinese: 卧豹骑士立即客气地表示同意。

sentences.english: He's my patient, " she said bluntly ."
sentences.chinese: “他是我的病人，”她毫不客气的说。

sentences.english: Now that there are peasant associations, the landlords can be bluntly ordered to repair the embankments.
sentences.chinese: 有了农会，可以不客气地发命令强迫地主修塘坝了。

sentences.english: Again, feel free to leave your spray-painted signature.
sentences.chinese: 再一次提醒，不用客气，留下您的喷漆签名。

sentences.english: This by no means guarantees gentle treatment by the police.
sentences.chinese: 这绝不保证警察们会客客气气的。

sentences.english: Donald has chance umbrageous at his friends for creature so unkind.
sentences.chinese: 唐纳德因为他的朋友太不客气，所以被激怒了。

sentences.english: Politeness is the most potent rebuke to insolence.
sentences.chinese: 客气是对傲慢最有效的谴责。

sentences.english: His words were polite but there was an overtone of anger in his voice.
sentences.chinese: 他客气的话语中实际有愤怒之声。

definition: to regard sb as an outsider
words of politeness/politesse/decorous talking/talk with propriety
you're welcome/don't mention it/no need to stand on ceremony
to call out to/to greet/to say hello to/to inform/to take care of/to take care that one does not
to show deference or praise publicly
